unnormalised: Okay, so I went on a bit of a shopping spree last week, and let me tell you, my bank account is *definitely* feeling it. First off, I needed new bedsheets. Headed straight to D'Mart and ended up spending Rs. 1299 on a set I'd been eyeing for ages. They had a 20% off sale, so obviously, I couldn't resist! Plus, they looked super comfy, like a cloud you can sleep on, right?
normalised: Okay, so I went on a bit of a shopping spree last week, and let me tell you, my bank account is definitely feeling it. First off, I needed new bedsheets. Headed straight to D-Mart and ended up spending rupee one thousand two hundred and ninety nine on a set I'd been eyeing for ages. They had a twenty percent off sale, so obviously, I couldn't resist! Plus, they looked super comfy, like a cloud you can sleep on, right?

unnormalised: Then there's the whole grocery situation. As usual, the bill came out to around Rs. 3500 at Reliance Fresh. And let me tell you, inflation is real! Potatoes are now like Rs. 40 per kg?! What is going on?! I swear, grocery shopping feels like a financial marathon these days. I even tried to haggle with the sabzi-wala outside, but he wouldn't budge from Rs 35/kg for tomatoes.
normalised: Then there's the whole grocery situation. As usual, the bill came out to around rupee three thousand five hundred at Reliance Fresh. And let me tell you, inflation is real! Potatoes are now like rupee forty per kilogram?! What is going on?! I swear, grocery shopping feels like a financial marathon these days. I even tried to haggle with the sabzi-wala outside, but he wouldn't budge from rupee thirty five per kilogram for tomatoes.

unnormalised: Online shopping is another beast altogether. Flipkart was having a 'Big Billion Days' thing, and I somehow landed on a new pair of noise-cancelling headphones. They were marked down from Rs. 5999 to Rs. 3999. A steal, I thought! Until I realised I already have like, three pairs of headphones. But hey, this one is "superior", so it's justified, ya?
normalised: Online shopping is another beast altogether. Flipkart was having a 'Big Billion Days' thing, and I somehow landed on a new pair of noise-cancelling headphones. They were marked down from rupee five thousand nine hundred and ninety nine to rupee three thousand nine hundred and ninety nine. A steal, I thought! Until I realised I already have like, three pairs of headphones. But hey, this one is "superior", so it's justified, ya?

unnormalised: Oh, and I went to that new cafe in Bandra – "Chai & Chill". Spent like, Rs. 800 on two chai and a sandwich. The sandwich was good, I'll give them that, but Rs. 800?! I could've made the same at home for less than Rs. 200! Guess I’m paying for the ambiance. The decor was quite something though.
normalised: Oh, and I went to that new cafe in Bandra – "Chai and Chill". Spent like, rupee eight hundred on two chai and a sandwich. The sandwich was good, I'll give them that, but rupee eight hundred?! I could've made the same at home for less than rupee two hundred! Guess I’m paying for the ambiance. The decor was quite something though.

unnormalised: Then there's the auto-rickshaw fares. I swear, every time I take an auto, the meter seems to be rigged. A short trip that should cost Rs. 60 ends up being Rs. 80 every single time. Maybe I should just invest in a bicycle. Or learn to teleport. Either would be more economical at this point.
normalised: Then there's the auto-rickshaw fares. I swear, every time I take an auto, the meter seems to be rigged. A short trip that should cost rupee sixty ends up being rupee eighty every single time. Maybe I should just invest in a bicycle. Or learn to teleport. Either would be more economical at this point.

unnormalised: And finally, to top it all off, my phone bill arrived. Rs. 799 for unlimited data, which, let's be honest, isn't really unlimited when you hit that 2GB/day limit. I’m starting to think that maybe I need a digital detox. Or a sugar daddy.
normalised: And finally, to top it all off, my phone bill arrived. Rupee seven hundred and ninety nine for unlimited data, which, let's be honest, isn't really unlimited when you hit that two gigabyte per day limit. I’m starting to think that maybe I need a digital detox. Or a sugar daddy.

unnormalised: So yeah, that’s my retail story from last week. A cautionary tale, perhaps? Or just a relatable account of modern life. Anyway, wish me luck convincing my landlord that my shopping habits are a valid excuse for being a little late on the rent next month. Maybe I should sell my old bedsheets for Rs 500 online? Any takers?
normalised: So yeah, that’s my retail story from last week. A cautionary tale, perhaps? Or just a relatable account of modern life. Anyway, wish me luck convincing my landlord that my shopping habits are a valid excuse for being a little late on the rent next month. Maybe I should sell my old bedsheets for rupee five hundred online? Any takers?
